article.headline: Louisiana-Lafayette 63, Arkansas State 73
article.story: LAFAYETTE, La. (AP) -- Isaac Wells scored 18 points to lead Arkansas State to a 73-63 victory over Louisiana-Lafayette on Sunday. A 14-0 run to open the second half helped the Indians (7-7, 2-0 Sun Belt Conference) erase a 35-28 halftime deficit. Arkansas State never trailed again. The loss was the third straight for Louisiana-Lafayette (2-8, 0-2 ). Ryan Wedel scored 15 for Arkansas State -- including 3-of-5 from 3-point range, Adrian Banks had 13 and Abayomi Ajasin added 11. The Cajuns were led by the tandem of David Dees and Ross Mouton who each scored 14 points. Willie Lago dropped in 11.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
